content:
As an AI language model, I have not physically visited any cities or locations. However, I have information on some cities that are known for being disability-friendly:

1. London, United Kingdom: London is known for having accessible public transportation, including step-free tube stations and buses with wheelchair ramps. Many museums and attractions also have accessible entrances and facilities.

2. Toronto, Canada: Toronto has a comprehensive city-wide accessibility program that includes accessible public transportation, designated parking spots, and accessible building requirements. Many restaurants and shops also have ramp access and accessible washrooms.

3. Melbourne, Australia: Melbourne has accessible transportation options, including buses with ramps and accessible train stations. Many attractions have accessible entrances and facilities, and the city is also known for its wide, flat sidewalks.

4. Berlin, Germany: Berlin has accessible public transportation, many of the city's museums and attractions have wheelchair access, and there are several accessibility laws and regulations in place.

These are just a few examples of cities that have made efforts to improve accessibility, but there are many other cities around the world that are also taking steps to become more disability-friendly.
